title.narrative: CHILDREN AND YOUTH PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: Children and youth, especially in the most disadvantaged zobas, have the knowledge and skills to participate in school and community-based activities., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Eritrean girls and boys in four Zobas have access to quality Basic Education and Child Protection Services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and youth, especially in the most disadvantaged zobas, have the knowledge and skills to participate in school andcommunity-based activities.

description.narrative: With UNICEF support a total of 122 adolescents/ young people (55 females) across the country’s six regions were engaged in school- and community-based activities;;such as forums for learning, personal empowerment, digital livelihoods and active citizenship;;resulting in the strengthening of meaningful adolescent and youth participation and identification of key issues to be addressed to ensure equitable access to basic social services. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
